title: Why is Syndra no longer on Zed's universe page
body: I noticed around the time Syndra's bio was updated and she got that short story she had gone away from his universe page. Im sure im not the only one who probably wondered why she was there to begin with and I waited for a reason even keeping up with her lore. But now i just wonder why she is gone and it some what disappoints me to see her gone because i waited for so long to know why she was there.

On a tangential note, I am more and more annoyed each new time you dismiss yet another remark with a "joke". Geez.

It's slowly eroding any goodwill I could have for Riot worldbuilding/narrative team. I tried to politely and constructively voice my concerns and my disagreements with Riot's decisions over the past year or so, and all I got in return was condescension, when my points were acknowledged at all. And it's not just with me, I fervently follow the Red Tracker and read all your posts, and you never engage in discussion. You just joke around and dismiss us readers.

Well, do as you wish, but know that you're losing my faith.
Thankfully I'm not the only one who feels that way.

I'm sorry if it has come across to either of you as dismissive - it's definitely not intended as such.

Speaking from my perspective, it's difficult to tell which comments/threads are serious and which are not. Much like you feel my replies might be unnecessarily joke-heavy, I can't always tell from posts like these if you have a genuine concern, or if you're just engaging in online banter. I will try to read more into your context in future, and I would ask that you do the same in return.

I feel like I addressed the actual question in this thread: **"Why are these champions no longer connected?"**
Because they are not connected, in any meaningful lore sense. They are not part of the same faction (Ionia being possibly the least united/aligned region in the lore) and they have likely never met.

A follow-up question here could be: **"Well then, why were they ever linked?"** And to be clear, my answer to that echoes what others have said - they probably shouldn't have been. So we fixed it.

Will they ever be linked? Who knows - maybe if they actually have some interactions. I guess we will wait and see where their stories go.

In the past, champions were linked because it was convenient to do so, and VERY FEW actual links existed. We don't do that anymore, and we are fixing the ones that exist, for precisely the reasons shown in this thread - it gives people false or unreasonable expectations about those characters, which we are not intending to pay off. So, if a Rioter previously said "We link champions because you might also like this other one" then that is no longer the case.

Please do let me know if there is any other question you would like me to answer. :-)

> I will try to read more into your context in future, **and I would ask that you do the same in return.**

Well, I currently do. But as time passes by and I don't feel you return the favor, this is an effort I am less and less willing to do. 

> A follow-up question here could be: "Well then, why were they ever linked?" And to be clear, my answer to that echoes what others have said - they probably shouldn't have been. So we fixed it.

See, that's the problem, that's the concern I tried to raise, and it obviously didn't go through. Maybe I'm not clear, but heck do I try...

So I'll try once again: **There definitely was a good reason for them to be linked in the old lore.**

Maybe there isn't anymore, and YOU are in control of the new lore that's created, so on that aspect, I 100% defer to you. The problem is NOT that you removed the connection on the Universe page.

No, the problem is that you fail to acknowledge there WAS a reason, and that's only one new sign in a very long list that, from my limited knowledge and point of view, I can only interpret as you not recognizing/understanding the value in the old lore. And to be clear, I have full confidence that you and your team are able to create great new stories. But I don't want that to be at the expense of the slightly-less-great older stories.

I could elaborate on that, and I'll gladly do if you ask me to, but at this point, I think brevity and clarity are more important, so I'll stop there for today.

These are all valid comments, and I'm aware that there is pain when stuff gets changed. That sucks.

ThermalKitten and I have been quite open about this - we want to minimise player pain when we update lore. We have tried a few approaches, and we have more in mind that we'd like to try out. However... some old lore is going to change, completely. The Journals and the Institute, Summoner's Rift being a location, all of that is most definitely not canon anymore, and we can't cling to it when we plan out new stuff. That's not even our call to make, actually.

(Did you get a chance to watch the Narrative panel from PAX West, this last weekend? We actually touch on this, and some players said it helped them to understand why we had to change certain elements of the old lore.)

I would always pledge that we don't change stuff just for the sake of it. It HAS to be for a reason, and now we can be a little more open because Riot has adopted a more open stance on this. We are working towards other products beyond League, and the old lore and really early versions of champions don't really fit within that.

However (again!) we can and should try to honour the themes of older lore, where possible and appropriate. With reference to Zed and Syndra, those champions are simply not in the same mindset or looking to the same goals right now, at all. In fact, they'd probably be enemies, if they met today - Zed would likely see Syndra as a dangerous liability for their homeland. But as I said, they might come to be closer, or linked in some way, as stories develop. Time will tell, and then we might give them some sort of formal link on Universe.

I'm looking at the lore with the fresh eyes of someone who HASN'T been following it for years - that's one of the reasons I was hired. I saw a player ask why Syndra and Zed were linked, and I could find no lore-based reason, in the up-to-date lore, that we consider canon. So we made the call to change it. Nothing more sinister than that. :-)

We want to make this lore fun and accessible for new players, as well as keeping true to the characters and places that existing players love.

There is a lot going on here.

You said you were hired (in part) **because** you didn't follow the old lore for years. Well, I was, which means I **also** followed all the reasoning of why the great Institute of War/Summoner's Rift retcon was necessary. And I agreed with that, I'm not absolutely opposed to any change! You painted yourself into a corner, so sacrifice had to be made, and I'm fine with that.

What I wish for, though, is that **the retcons are minimized**. I understand the paradigm shift, and I understand that such a big shift will have more repercussions down the line, but I'd hope that you and Riot would consider everything not directly related to the IoW/SR as still canon, and would make a conscious effort to keep as much of it as possible.

But from what I can see, that's not your current stance at all. From what I can see, everything that was published before the great retcon is obsolete, even if it's not directly related to what was actually retcon'ed, and treated as mere inspiration, as tonal indications, as a mood board, but definitely not as factual canon. And even that last post of yours, which is supposed to reassure me that there is "nothing sinister", only reinforce that impression. Still, thank you for posting it, I prefer to clearly know where we stand, even if I don't like it.

So in the end, I guess the core of the problem is that: **what does Riot actually consider canon?**

**Before today**, I thought that your official stance was "anything that doesn't involve the Institute of War is still canon", and that was a stance I totally agreed with (and I was angry because what you actually published didn't fit that stance).
**Now** I get the feeling that it's more "nothing published before the great retcon is canon, we'll try to keep it if it fits well, but everything is open for change".

But can we get a clear and official answer from you? What does Riot actually consider canon? (And no, I didn't see the Pax panel.)

_____

So yeah, the important part is above. If you're short on time, you can stop here and ignore everything below, but I have a couple more unconnected points I want to get off my chest.

1) To elaborate a bit, what really irks me is that the old lore wasn't really developed much. There was precious little of it, and most of it was vague, coming from blatantly unreliable narrators. Overall, it wasn't setting many constraints. So I wouldn't pretend to do your job for you, I only have my perspective as a reader, but it really feels like it should be reasonably easy to abide by what I thought was the official stance. To integrate most of it in the new canon. To expand upon it and build around it, and to change a few details here and there where needed, and pretend it's due to unreliable sources. In that context, I'm ready to stretch my suspension of disbelief a bit, even if the old and new versions don't perfectly fit together.
In short, I feel like I wasn't wishing for much, and I'm still let down.

2) In a certain way, it feels like instead of starting from the old lore and trying to minimize the changes, you're starting from scratch and trying to maximize the overlap with the old version, which in theory should lead to a similar result, but in practice makes the new version feel "off".

3) Seriously, this discussion would have never happened if, after I said "they were marked as friend because they were politically aligned, and I think that's still the case today" you had directly answered with "No it's not, Zed would probably see her as a liability for Ionia now", instead of a joke about Bruce Willis hairstyle.
Maybe that's not a bad thing, maybe we needed to have that discussion, but damn, actually answering my point was just as short and quick as making that joke... -_-

4) To be very clear, I don't give a damn about Zed and Syndra specifically. I care about the status of the old lore as a whole. What prompted me to post in that thread was not an attachment to Zed or Syndra, it was you acting as if there never was a good reason in the first place, instead of saying that the reason had changed due to the newly released lore. "Things never existed" is very different from "Things changed".

I'm really busy today, but I wanted you to know that I read all of your post and I want to continue the conversation in a timely fashion. :-)

I think there is a slight misunderstanding here, though - we've never said "This never existed" about anything in the lore/canon, nor do we intend to throw everything out from before 2014.

However... what we are (I hope, consistently) saying is *"Anything that is not currently on Universe or the Runeterra map is not canon, and we are not guaranteeing that it will be restored in any way"*. If something is not player-facing on either of those two locations right now, please don't hold your breath for it to return, because it might not, ever.

(However, MY personal pain point is that some stuff that existed before November last year is also wobbly in terms of how "canon" it is, and we just haven't gotten around to removing or updating it yet. It sucks that I am only really allowed to vaguely wave my hand and say "We're getting to it", but I can't even highlight which parts of the lore it would include.)

The only other option was to completely remove everything that wasn't considered canon last November, and then add stuff back in as we worked on it. I still feel that would have been a worse experience for players, worldwide...

But anything published since November 2017, you can have much higher confidence that we won't change it anytime soon. And lots of other stuff that is older also will not be changing. But some stuff will. I just can't really say which parts at this stage.

I'd hope we can repay your trust and patience by actually making it BETTER, in the long term. :-)

> However... what we are (I hope, consistently) saying is **"Anything that is not currently on Universe or the Runeterra map is not canon, and we are not guaranteeing that it will be restored in any way"**. If something is not player-facing on either of those two locations right now, please don't hold your breath for it to return, because it might not, ever.

Well, at least now it's clear, thank you for that. But I can't say that the message was consistent, no. As I said in my previous post, I thought the official stance was "anything not involving the IoW is still canon".

> But anything published since November 2017, you can have much higher confidence that we won't change it anytime soon.

November 2017 is an awfully recent date... The great IoW retcon was announced in September 2014, and probably prepared behind the scene a few months before that, I imagine ( https://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/creative-spotlight/dev-blog-exploring-runeterra ). Between September 2014 and November 2017, that's 3 full years with questionable status, **after you already decided to start with a new paradigm**! How the heck did that happen?

And why wasn't a dev blog similar to that old 2014 one released, explaining the situation? I appreciate you coming to the Boards (or that PAX panel you mentioned but is it available online?), but why isn't there any official communication broadly available?

As I said I'm not opposed to change on principles, and as you said, you don't do changes just for the sake of change, but if Riot doesn't explain the situation, what are readers supposed to think?

>And lots of other stuff that is older also will not be changing.

You sure about that?

I'd hope, as time goes on and we continue to develop and deepen the lore, players who REALLY loved the old stuff will see that we're gradually improving the quality of writing, as well as the consistency between stories.
